title: See a lot of Chinese players in gold
body: This is my first season in gold, and ever since I've been here I don't think I've had a game where there wasn't at least one chinese player, is it just gold or is this a thing popping up everywhere in ranked?

replies.body: Not sure about other elo's but there are plenty of them in silver, and I've never seen a decent Chinese. All of them usually feed or do bad overall. Then flame in chinese with words like "shabi" "caonima" which means "stupid %%%%" and "fuck your mother" respectively. It's actually pretty hilarious. xd
But what would a decent Chinese play say to you, to inform you that he is a Chinese?

> [{quoted}](name=THE KOA,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=3HtgsaKA,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-05-05T11:48:26.443+0000)

> But what would a decent Chinese play say to you, to inform you that he is a Chinese?

'sb'
'shabi'
'caonima'
'???'
'666'
(Rage about why you didn't give mid when he gets sup in draft)
(Other comments insulting your mother)
(Clicks madly on your respawn time)
(Flips out at mention of Taiwan)

There you go. Those aren't sterotypes, I played on LAN and EUW I don't recall anyone saying 'shabi' or 'caonima' there or has a total fit about Taiwan.

FYI those are often banned players from Garena coming to OCE for a toxic holiday.

Perhaps because the Asian populations on LA and EU are almost nil? Australasia and New Zealand are popular places for Asians to emigrate to for a wide variety of reasons, just as LA and EU are not so popular places for Asians to emigrate to for a variety of reasons.

Neutral players of *any* nationality go basically unnoticed. You don't remember the games where nothing bad or especially good happened. The toxic players get noticed and feel like they are more prevalent than they are for the same reason. It's called negativity bias.

Half the players you encounter that don't say anything could be Chinese, you wouldn't know, but you aren't counting them in you anecdotal statistics. *Toxicity* is what makes players toxic, not where they were born or where their parents were born.

If you exchange 'sb' for 'drongo' and 'caonima' with 'fuckin c%%%' (comments we also see), does that mean all Australians are toxic? Is it relevant that you don't see such comments on LAN or EUW?

At no point did I say toxicity doesn't exist. Nor did I at any point say that Chinese toxicity doesn't exist. What I said was, not all Chinese players are toxic, and labelling them as such is blatantly racist.
How am i to believe your words? Do you have any statistics that you've archived to back up those claims?
swear in chinese about the other team but also emote whenever I make a good play.

There just seem to be more individuals who utilise asian languages in general, whether they're chinese or not is impossible to discern however they're generally ridiculously obnoxious, especially since Riot's word buster won't bust them
